metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14165 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ReadSUNImage function in coders/sun.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has anissue where memory allocation is excessive because it depends only on alength field in a header. This may lead to remote denial of service in theMagickMalloc function in magick/memory.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-9
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-9
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-9
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-9
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-9').
